business.headline: From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.
Sensex and Nifty erase early gains to end flat over global uncertaintyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 27.46 points to close at 82,248.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.05 points to end at 25,496.55.

MeitY Secretary S Krishnan says social media must work within constitutional limitsS Krishnan defended the government's approach to regulating digital platforms. He said the Ministry's actions are firmly rooted in the Constitution and follow due legal process.

Gold jumped 72% and silver soared 122% last year. Can 2026 deliver the same rally?Gold and silver may not climb the way they did in 2025, but the base remains firm. This year calls for clear judgement, realistic expectations and a focus on long-term signals.

Government mandates 20% ethanol-blended petrol with RON 95 from April 1In a notification issued on February 17, the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas directed oil marketing companies to supply ethanol-blended petrol, also called E20 petrol, across all states and Union Territories.

entertainment.headline: Ranabaali: Rashmika-Vijay's big surprise after wedding coming up on February 28 After sparking massive excitement with their wedding pictures, Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are once again grabbing attention, this time for their upcoming film Ranabaali. The duo has teased a major surprise set to be unveiled on February 28.

The Kerala Story 2 producer Vipul Shah reacts as High Court clears film's release Vipul Shah welcomed the Kerala High Court's decision to lift the interim stay on The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond. The order was passed by a division bench comprising Justices SA Dharmadhikari and PV Balakrishnan.

Who is Sangeetha Sornalingam? Actor Vijay's wife files for divorce after 27 years Sangeetha Sornalingam, wife of Tamil actor and TVK chief Vijay, has filed for divorce in the Chengalpattu family court, alleging her husband's involvement in an extramarital affair. The couple, married since 1999, has two children together.

Prakash Raj exits Prabhas and Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Spirit: Report Actor Prakash Raj has reportedly exited Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film Spirit, starring Prabhas. The update came as the team welcomed Vivek Oberoi as part of the cast.

Vishnu Vinyasam review: Sree Vishnu's film is a painful collection of unfunny reelsRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Vishnu Vinyasam movie review: Director Yadunaath Maruthi Rao's Vishnu Vinyasam, starring Sree Vishnu and Nayan Sarika, is a painfully unfunny film. The film draws inspiration from many social media trends, but has zero impact.

Sriram Raghavan addresses Ikkis backlash; says those objecting haven't seen the film Sriram Raghavan admitted that he was baffled at the first reactions to his war-drama Ikkis. He said that those who have objected haven't even seen the film.

Dipika Kakar in pain after cyst surgery, shares health update in new vlog Actor Dipika Kakar has undergone a second liver surgery after being diagnosed with a malignant tumour last year. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, confirmed the success of the procedure and provided an update on her current health.

Zubeen Garg honoured posthumously with 3 Filmfare Awards for contribution to music Iconic singer Zubeen Garg was honoured at the Filmfare Awards Assamese 2026 in Guwahati with a heartfelt tribute. The late artist received three posthumous awards, recognising his enduring contribution to music and Assamese cinema.

2017 Kerala actor assault case: State government challenges Dileep's acquittal The Kerala government has filed an appeal in the High Court challenging the acquittal of actor Dileep and three others. The state also sought stronger sentences for those already convicted in the 2017 actor assault case.

Boong set for release. Check date when BAFTA-winning film arrives in theatres Farhan Akhtar announced the theatrical release date of his BAFTA-winning Manipuri film Boong. The Lakshmipriya Devi directorial won the award in Best Children's and Family Film category.

Spirit: Vivek Oberoi joins Sandeep Reddy Vanga's dark world. See poster Sandeep Reddy Vanga has added Vivek Oberoi to the cast of his upcoming film, Spirit. The actor's first-look poster screams raw intensity and quiet menace.

Karan Johar calls artists 'nobodies', says loyalty is myth in Bollywood Karan Johar opened up about actors' "insecurities" and lack of loyalty in Bollywood. He called talent management a "thankless job" amid reports of Janhvi Kapoor exiting his agency.

Deadline review: BLACKPINK still know how to chant their way into your head BLACKPINK made a confident return with Deadline, delivering a sleek, global sound driven by strong English lyrics and personal touches. Balancing bold anthems with softer moments, the mini-album reinforced their place at the top of modern pop.

Actor and TVK chief Vijay's wife files for divorce, alleges affair with actor Actor and TVK chief Vijay's wife, Sangeetha, has filed for divorce. She has accused Vijay of infidelity, alleging that he was involved in an extramarital relationship with a fellow actor.

Inside Aly-Jasmin's lavish Iftar and birthday celebration. See who attended Television actors Aly Goni and Jasmin Bhasin hosted an Iftar party in Mumbai to celebrate Goni's birthday during Ramzan 2026. The get-together brought their friends from the entertainment industry for an evening of festive celebration.

The Secret Agent review: Wagner Maura's film is haunting and politically astute The Secret Agent movie review: Wagner Maura's film explores life under Brazil's 1977 military dictatorship through a haunting political thriller. The film reflects on the lasting impact of surveillance and authoritarian fear on individuals and society.

The Kerala Story 2 cleared for release after High Court bench lifts stay The Kerala High Court has lifted the interim stay on The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond, just hours after a single-judge bench had halted its release and questioned the CBFC's U/A certification.

Rajamouli's Varanasi: Watch update Priyanka Chopra shared on Jimmy Fallon's Show Priyanka Chopra spoke about her upcoming film Varanasi, directed by SS Rajamouli, during her appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. She expressed enthusiasm for her first Indian movie in years.

Sai Pallavi set to replace Deepika Padukone in Kalki 2, role not scrapped: Report Sai Pallavi is reportedly replacing Deepika Padukone in Kalki 2, the sequel to the blockbuster Kalki 2898 AD. The shooting of the film has already begun.

general news.headline: India, EU agree on 5-year Most Favoured Nation status, shows draft trade dealIndia, EU agree on 5-year Most Favoured Nation status, shows draft trade deal

Delhi liquor policy case: Kejriwal sheds tears as court shreds CBIThe four-year-long Delhi liquor policy case, which saw AAP's top leaders, including chief Arvind Kejriwal, arrested, potentially cost them the assembly polls last year. Now, a Delhi court has given Kejriwal, his ex-deputy Manish Sisodia and 21 others a clean chit, saying the CBI case lacks foundation and is based almost entirely on conjecture.

Actor and TVK chief Vijay's wife files for divorce, alleges affair with actorActor and TVK chief Vijay's wife, Sangeetha, has filed for divorce. She has accused Vijay of infidelity, alleging that he was involved in an extramarital relationship with a fellow actor.

How ragtag Taliban Air Force is raining fire deep inside PakistanThe Taliban-led Afghan military, dismissed as fragmented and under-equipped, has claimed it carried out air and drone strikes on multiple Pakistani military targets, including sites near Islamabad. This is how the ragtag military rained fire and retaliated to Pakistani strikes from the sky.

Rashmika-Vijay make 1st public appearance as Mrs and Mr at Udaipur airport. WatchRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have finally made their first appearances as a married couple. They were clicked waving and blowing kisses to the paps stationed at the Udaipur airport on Friday.

How can Pakistan qualify for semifinal? NRR scenarios for PAK vs SL explainedT20 World Cup Pakistan's semi final qualification scenario: England's four-wicket victory over New Zealand has kept Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive in the tournament. Here's the complete explanation of what Pakistan need to do to progress ahead in the event:

Popular ex-Muslim YouTuber Saleem Wastik stabbed in Ghaziabad, condition criticalPopular ex-Muslim YouTuber Saleem Wastik was repeatedly stabbed in his neck and abdomen by two men on Friday. The men entered Wastik's home in Ghaziabad's Loni, attacked him and fled. Wastik, who appeared on several TV shows, is battling for life.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Watch: IAF showcases its might during Vayu Shakti exercise at Pokhran firing rangeThe Indian Air Force (IAF) on Friday displayed its full spectrum of offensive and defensive capabilities in a simulated war environment during the 'Vayu Shakti–2026' exercise at the Pokhran Firing Range, Jaisalmer.

Job worries, visa delays: Why Indian enrolments in US varsities fell sharply by 45%A white paper by the Graduate Management Admission Council has found that the enrolment of Indian students in US universities has fallen by at least 45%, driven by delays in obtaining student visas, as well as concerns over future employment opportunities and the political environment in the US.

Afghanistan: The graveyard of empires, and now Pakistan's nightmareTension had been brewing since February 21 when Pakistan launched airstrikes on Afghanistan's Nangarhar, Paktika, and Khost provinces, claiming to target seven militant camps linked to the TTP and Islamic State Khorasan.

IPL 2026 likely to start on March 28, final to be played on May 31The Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026) is likely to start on March 28 with the final of the competition to be played on May 31. The tournament was initially expected to get under way on March 26. However, the start date has now been pushed back by two days.

One job for 10 years or 10 jobs in 10 years: What works today?In today's economy, staying isn't loyalty and switching isn't impatience; the real question is whether your career is compounding or standing still.

Hold polls in Delhi, will quit politics if BJP wins over 10 seats: Arvind KejriwalEarlier on Friday, Arvind Kejriwal and former Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia were discharged in the Delhi excise policy case as the Rouse Avenue noted that there was no sufficient evidence in the case.

Live: Amid Afghanistan border tensions, Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif meets army chiefPakistan-Afghanistan War Live Updates: Pakistan has launched Operation Ghazib Lil-haq against Afghanistan, targeting several military installations in cities like Kabul, Paktia, and Kandahar, after the border conflict between the two countries escalated on Thursday. Earlier, the Taliban administration in Afghanistan claimed that it had conquered 19 Pakistani checkposts, killing 55 soldiers in large-scale airstrikes. Catch all the live updates of the fresh tension in Indiatoday.in.

Who is Sangeetha Sornalingam? Actor Vijay's wife files for divorce after 27 yearsSangeetha Sornalingam, wife of Tamil actor and TVK chief Vijay, has filed for divorce in the Chengalpattu family court, alleging her husband's involvement in an extramarital affair. The couple, married since 1999, has two children together.

He wrote India's first Constitution draft, but history forgot himIndia's Constitution had a long journey before being finalised, and it took the efforts of many individuals. BN Rau was one major figure behind it. He travelled to America and Europe to understand and discuss various aspects of law. As Constituional adviser to the Constituent Assembly of India, he penned the first draft.

North India to witness dry weather on Saturday, hills can expect rainIndia faces rising temperatures and humidity as February ends with a massive rain deficit. Experts predict heat waves in coastal areas and light snow in the Himalayas.

Deepinder Goyal's startup Temple is hiring, but he has some fitness requirementsDeepinder Goyal's startup Temple is hiring engineers with strict fitness standards to develop next-generation wearables. Social media users, however, have mixed feelings about the criteria.

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

How Indraprastha became DelhiA BJP MP has demanded that New Delhi be named Indraprastha. But how did Indraprastha, associated with the Pandavas of Mahabharata, get the name Delhi? The etymological roots can be traced back to over 2,000 years ago to Raja Dhillu. Here's how India's National Capital got various names through the ages, till New Delhi stuck.

Economically illiterate: CBI faces Delhi court ire over liquor policy case probeIn its order discharging all the 23 accused in the excise policy scam case, including former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia, the Rouse Avenue Court said the CBI's probe narrative was speculative, legally untenable and driven by preconceived assumptions rather than evidence.

Amma loyalist OPS pole vaults into the DMK as Stalin prepares for title defenceOPS, former AIADMK chief minister, joins DMK ahead of assembly elections. This move sets up a direct political battle with EPS and reshapes Tamil Nadu's political landscape.

Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu reveals list of 10 jobs that are safe from AI and pay wellZoho founder Sridhar Vembu says the AI era will force societies to rethink work, value, and purpose, with human-centred roles staying relevant even as machines take over productivity.

sports.headline: Ravi Shastri to have stand named after him at Mumbai's Wankhede stadium Wankhede Stadium honours cricket legends as MCA names stand after Ravi Shastri and dedicates three gates to Dilip Sardesai, Diana Edulji and Eknath Solkar in tribute to Mumbai's rich heritage.

How can Pakistan qualify for semi final after New Zealand's loss to England? England's victory over New Zealand keeps Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive in ICC T20 World Cup 2026. Pakistan must win convincingly against Sri Lanka to secure a semi-final berth.

Pakistan stay alive for semis berth after England beat New Zealand in Colombo T20 World Cup, ENG vs NZ: England beat New Zealand by four wickets in Colombo on Saturday after chasing down 160 with three balls to spare. With England's win, Pakistan also stayed alive in the competition and will have everything to play for when they face Sri Lanka.

T20 World Cup: Rinku Singh to link-up with Indian team in Kolkata after father's last rites T20 World Cup: Rinku Singh is set to rejoin the India camp after completing his father Khanchand Singh's last rites in Aligarh.  India are set to face the West Indies in their final Super 8s fixture in Kolkata.

Can Pakistan reach the semis? Salman Mirza stays optimistic before Sri Lanka clash T20 World Cup, PAK vs SL: Pakistan pacer Salman Mirza opened up on his team's chances of qualifying for the semi-finals. Pakistan's last Super 8 match is against Sri Lanka on February 28.

IPL 2026 likely to start on March 28, final to be played on May 31 The Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026) is likely to start on March 28 with the final of the competition to be played on May 31. The tournament was initially expected to get under way on March 26. However, the start date has now been pushed back by two days.

Ranji Trophy final: Auqib Nabi, Qamran Iqbal take J&K on cusp of historic triumph Jammu and Kashmir finished Day 4 of the Ranji Trophy final in a strong position against Karnataka. Their dominant performance have brought them closer to their maiden title victory.

J&K on brink of maiden Ranji Trophy title as CM Omar Abdullah heads to final venue Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah is heading to Hubli as the state stands on the brink of winning their maiden Ranji Trophy title with a commanding 477-run lead over Karnataka.

ENG vs NZ Live Score Super 8: Ahmed, Jacks guide England home, keep Pakistan alive England (ENG) vs New Zealand (NZ) Live Score, T20 World Cup Super 8: England have beaten New Zealand by 4 wickets and kept Pakistan alive in the semi finals race. Will Jacks and Rehan Ahmed guided England home.

Real Madrid to face Man City as UCL's R016 serves up heavyweight clashes UEFA Champions League: Real Madrid will face Manchester City in a heavyweight clash as the Champions League Round of 16 draw delivered blockbuster matchups, with PSG taking on Chelsea in another standout fixture.

India Women make horror start to post World Cup-era, lose ODI series to Australia INDW vs AUSW: India defeated Australia by five wickets in the second ODI on Friday to take a 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Chasing 252, Georgia Voll's 101 helped the Aussies romp home with 83 balls to spare.

Rinku Singh stands in silent grief, shoulders father's mortal remains in AligarhIndia batter Rinku Singh performed the last rites of his father Khanchand Singh, who died after a prolonged battle with liver cancer. The cricketing fraternity also expressed condolences to Rinku and his family.

Rinku Singh's father passes away, Kohli leads tributes from Indian cricket fraternityThe Indian cricket fraternity united in support of Rinku Singh after his father's passing, with Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh, and several other stars offering heartfelt condolences and prayers.

Smriti Mandhana, Ellyse Perry reunite in Hobart, exchange smiles, friendly chatINDW vs AUSW: Smriti Mandhana and Ellyse Perry reunited in Hobart during the second Women's ODI on Friday, February 27, at Bellerive Oval. Perry missed the earlier matches in the series after sustaining a quad injury during the T20Is.

Remember how to be fearless: How Gambhir got India batters firing again vs ZIMT20 World Cup: Tilak Varma revealed how Gautam Gambhir urged India to stick to fearless cricket before Zimbabwe clash. The message boosted confidence and played a key role in India's commanding Super 8 win.

Varun Chakravarthy will bounce back in IND vs WI: Irfan Pathan back spinnerT20 World Cup: Irfan Pathan flagged Varun Chakravarthy's recent dip as a concern but backed him to bounce back. He believes Eden Gardens could help the mystery spinner regain rhythm in India's must-win clash vs West Indies.

How did Brian Bennett tackle Jasprit Bumrah in IND vs ZIM? Zimbabwe batter revealsT20 World Cup: Zimbabwe's Brian Bennett revealed how he tackled the threat from Jasprit Bumrah during the clash against India in the Super 8 stage on Thursday, February 27. Bennett scored an impressive 97 to help Zimbabwe put on a fight against India.

Auqib Nabi for IND vs ENG? Ganguly urges selectors after Ranji final heroicsAuqib Nabi's five-wicket haul in the Ranji Trophy final has earned strong backing from Sourav Ganguly. The former India captain urged selectors to consider the J&K pacer for the England tour this summer.

Chennai's chettan can wait: Sanju Samson puts CSK buzz aside for T20 World CupT20 World Cup: Sanju Samson was thankful for the loud cheers he got in Chennai, but isn't ready to lose focus on the T20 World Cup 2026. Samson said that he is keeping the CSK excitement aside to focus on India's goal of retaining their crown.

Remembering Khanchand Singh: The father who shaped Rinku Singh's riseRinku Singh's father, Khachandra Singh, passed away during India's T20 World Cup campaign after battling stage 4 liver cancer. The man who delivered gas cylinders in Aligarh played a defining role in shaping India's calm new-age finisher.

ENG vs NZ: Pakistan hold their breath as New Zealand chase semi-final spotT20 World Cup: Pakistan will be keeping a close eye on the contest in Colombo as New Zealand and England lock horns in the Super 8 clash on Friday, February 27. A win for the Blackcaps will seal their spot and eliminate Pakistan from the tournament.

Shivam Dube's bowling lacks confidence: Ex-India batter flags key issueT20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra warned that Shivam Dube's bowling is becoming a concern for India. Ahead of the must-win clash against West Indies, fixing the sixth bowling option could prove crucial to their semi-final hopes.

The 15-minute Masterstroke: The video that rebuilt belief in India's dressing roomT20 World Cup: India bounced back strongly with a dominant batting display against Zimbabwe in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup. Following a 72-run win, Suryakumar Yadav revealed how the team management boosted their morale with a special video ahead of the fixture.

Abhishek Sharma back in form: Yuvraj's Insta story goes viral after IND vs ZIMYuvraj Singh praised Abhishek Sharma after his first T20 World Cup fifty helped India defeat Zimbabwe by 72 runs in Chennai. Abhishek roared back to form with the sensational knock after his initial struggles in the tournament.

In breezy Chepauk, Tilak Varma found his 23-year-old self againT20 World Cup, IND Vs ZIM Super 8: Under pressure and pushed down the order, Tilak Varma rediscovered freedom in Chennai, finishing strong against Zimbabwe before soaking in the Chepauk buzz like a 23-year-old unburdened again.

No days off: Hardik, Dube's post-match bowl-off leaves Sunil Gavaskar in aweT20 World Cup: Hardik Pandya and Shivam Dube decided to practise and work on their bowling right after India's win over Zimbabwe in Chennai. The work ethic and dedication from the all-rounder duo was praised by Sunil Gavaskar and Varun Aaron.

Tilak Varma unfazed by new batting role after Zimbabwe win: Will do what team needsT20 World Cup: Tilak Varma embraced a new role and delivered when India needed it most. His fearless cameo against Zimbabwe underlined his readiness to adapt for the team's cause.

Rinku Singh's father dies of liver cancer, cricketer flies home from ChennaiRinku Singh has left India's T20 World Cup camp in Chennai following the passing of his father, Khanchandra Singh. The 28-year-old has travelled to Aligarh to be with his family, with his availability for the remainder of the tournament now uncertain.

Sachin impressed with India's intent in Zimbabwe win: Take this rhythm aheadT20 World Cup: Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar praised India's intent after their must-win win vs Zimbabwe. Tendulkar urged the Suryakumar Yadav-led side to carry the same rhythm into the West Indies clash, which will be a must-win for their semi-final hopes.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
